page.title: 06ST FELIX CHURCH, FELIXKIRK
page.content: A house study group meets in the village weekly. Campanology is practised by an enthusaistic group of ringers. Ramps have been installed to enable easy access to the church by the disabled. Maintainance of the church is partially solved by the use of sheep and goats grazing there to keep the grass down. Every possibility of missionary work, taking the church out to the people to become part of society as a whole, is siezed eagerly by committed worshippers. Recently the church was redecorated through the Manpower Services Scheme.
